oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EFFECTS OF WAVE BREAKING AND BEACH SLOPE ON TOE SCOUR IN FRONT OF A VERTICAL SEAWALL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zou, Qingping
Peng, Zhong
Lin, Pengzhi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: vertical wall
beach
standing wave
breaking wave
RANS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Scour in front of coastal structures is a major threat to structural stability and safety of properties behind. In this study, a Reynolds Averaged Navier-Stokes Solver (RANS) is combined with a Volume of Fluid (VOF) (RANS-VOF) surface capturing scheme to investigate the wave interactions with a Seawall and its adjacent sea bed. The main objective is to investigate the effects of wave breaking and beach slope on toe scour in front of a vertical wall.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; sediment.122
